reviews.text: Beautiful hotel in convenient location. Close to the station for easy transfer to and from the airport and only a 10 minute stroll from the main square. Rooms are gorgeous and particularly liked the separate dressing room. Unlike other reviewers we found reception staff helpful, friendly and fluent in English. Breakfast buffet was excellent in stunning room. We booked a long time in advance and got a really good deal plus a room up-grade on arrival!
reviews.title: Stylish and comfortable

reviews.text: This hotel has taken the list of requirements to get 4 star status, and then engaged in clinical box ticking. The place is soulless and the rooms are depressing. The bathrooms smell because of centuries-old plumbing, and you can hear EVERYTHING your neighbours are doing.
reviews.title: Two stars, and that's being generous

reviews.text: Definitely avoid this place.
reviews.title: Excellent in every way

reviews.text: A group of us stayed at I Portici for a business trip and this hotel was perfect in every way. Conveniently located, spacious and immaculate rooms, parking and a wonderful breakfast. Speaking of breakfast, a treat was their fresh-squeezed orange juice machine where you serve yourself and the oranges are squeezed as you wait. The breakfast room, which doubles as their restaurant/dinner-theatre is beautiful. There is also a very nice bar with a terrace on the 2nd floor.
reviews.title: Perfect location, beautiful hotel

reviews.text: This hotel couldn't be in a more perfect location. It is a couple of blocks from the train station - an easy walk, even lugging big suitcases, and is in an ideal central location for shopping, sight-seeing, restaurants, people-watching, etc. The busy street, Via Independenza, is on one side of the hotel and a big serene park is on the other side (the quiet side) of the hotel. Our room was on the street side, and was a bit noisy, but not too bad; I enjoyed watching the beautiful Italians on the street below. The hotel is clean, has beautiful decor, exceptionally helpful staff, large bathrooms and big comfortable beds. I would definitely stay here again. The room price was very reasonable, but I do caution against ordering room service or eating the breakfast buffet. Although the service and the food was excellent, the prices were extraordinarily high. My friend and I arrived at the hotel on a very hot day and thought a cold beer in our room was a great idea. We just ordered it without checking prices and it ended up costing 24 Euros for 2 beers...ridiculous! In the morning we went for the breakfast buffet, assuming it was included in our room price, but after breakfast we were given a surprise bill of 30 Euros. I guess that's why the room prices are so low for this great hotel - they make their money on the food and drinks!
reviews.title: Enjoyed every second

reviews.text: We spent just 1 night at the I Porticihotel but out of all the 5 hotels we stayed in throughout Italy it was by far the best. Highly recommended, beautiful rooms & great value for money. If we ever end up in Bologna again this would be our first choice! We had a gorgeous room with a balcony overlooking the park - a must.
reviews.title: Unbelievable little gem

reviews.text: I loved the room, the view, the whole hotel. Beautiful. Great location also.
reviews.title: lovely

reviews.text: Great location, nice design but some architectural or construction errors. We were offered a room with a window at 2m high. Such rooms definitely do not qualify even 3* standards. They upgraded us to a room on the ground floor. We woke up a 530 am beceause the main hall was mechanically cleaned. Several guests complained. Should not have been an issue if the doors were properly soundproofed!
reviews.title: Not a 4*!

reviews.text: I have been in this hotel several times. Each one of them was a new discover. The beauty of the theater in which you have breakfast in the morning and at night time you can enjoy the dinner watching a live show is simpy amazing! I had to book a conference room for business and I have been very well assisted by the manager and his staff. Last time i got there i discover they opened a proper bar, another surprise! Past July I went on summer business having a kind of food show ond the "balconata" lighted by the candles, the food was amazing and the environment was charming! Yes this is definetly the place to enjoy your time in Bologna!
reviews.title: That's the place to go!

reviews.text: We really enjoyed staying at this hotel-the room was spacious and very comfortable and the staff consistently helpful and polite-their English was excellent.
reviews.title: Fabulous

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I loved the modern, minimalist and light-filled reception area when I arrived at i Portici and was excited about my stay. Sadly the room we had did not meet expectations. The street noise was unacceptable day and night - some sound proofing on the windows is required. The Aircon was very annoying - if you left it on at night it kept switching itself on and then off quite loudly and was impossible to control. The shower in our room was a pokey plastic unit that was very cheap and annoying to use - not sure why they chose this option as the rest of the bathroom had expensive fixtures and fittings. Lastly, I couldn't figure out why the bed was so uncomfortable to sleep in and finally I pulled the bottom sheet off to find a PLASTIC matress protector sheet on the matress. I hope they don't use these in all the rooms, and hope it was mistakenly put on our bed as it is not acceptable in the August heat of Bologna to have to put up with this in a top hotel. The hotel is within walking distance of the train station and all that central Bologna has to offer. The staff at reception were nice.
reviews.title: Modern and inviting, but the room was lacking in some areas

reviews.text: The hotel was hip and modern... white rooms... close to historic center, so it was easy for us to arrive by car. This is a nice location to do some shopping and to explore bologna...
reviews.title: Nice hotel- decent location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed in this hotel for 2 nights at the end of our 9 day trip to Italy because we were leaving early in the morning for the airport in Bologna. The hotel is nice and very modern. Our room was very clean. The only thing I didn't like was that the shower head was one of those rain showers that are attached to the wall which isn't convenient if you don't want to get your hair wet! But that wouldn't stop me staying at this hotel.
reviews.title: Nice Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Some people commented on the noisy mini-bar. It was indeed quite loud and quite useless too as we put some water in it and it hardly cooled it. As for the noise it makes there was a note that it automatically turns off at 9.30pm. Ours didn't turn off by itself so we turned it off from a button at the back for the duration of our stay.
reviews.title: Not worth SLH status. Can't complain too much since it's very cheap.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Overall a nice clean hotel to stay in. I can't comment on the breakfast though as we didn't have any (15euros extra per person).
reviews.title: Sparse but elegant

reviews.text: We stayed at I Portici twice within a 4 day period. The location is great, within easy walking distance to the train station, the Bologna restaurant area, and historical sites. Each room was very nice, one larger than the other, and we loved the duvet on their beds. One of the rooms had an outside terrace with table and chairs, great for kicking back.
reviews.title: Enjoyable, great staff, and very comfortable

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The restaurant was closed for their summer holiday, but the breakfast was good. I Portici has a wonderful outside bar area, where we enjoyed nightcaps. The hotel is located adjacent to a nice park, and there is a great flea market just a block away on Saturday's.
reviews.title: Excellent location but hotel more suited to business guests

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: There is some street noise, but it was not an issue for us, and I have stayed in far noisier hotels. The hotel is clean, well kept, and the staff were wonderful. If you are traveling from the USA, the rooms and bathrooms are smaller than what you would expect at home, but we did not have any issues.
reviews.title: Blown away from our room

reviews.text: Bologna is an excellent venue for a short break and I Portici is placed brilliantly - on a main shopping road into the historic centre, a short walk form all the places of interest and close to restaurants, galleries, churches, and museums. We walked from the central railway station after arriving from Venice and the hotel took only five minutes to reach, using a taxi would have been pointless. The immediate impression given by the hotel is positive - the reception is sharp and efficient and the appearance smart. Our room rather disappointed, however; I accept that the style - white, clean,simple lines - is a matter of taste and therefore cannot condemn it on that basis, but we were not impressed by the facilities it offered. There was inadequate storage - the open, drawerless wardrobe felt like student accommodation. The desk was similar to a student workbench and taken up with the noisy minibar. The en suite was small, the shower felt like a cheap plastic moulding and we had a metal pillar rising up about 35cm from the front of the toilet, a design I have seen nowhere else in the world. The wifi was free and very good. Breakfast at 15 euros was a tad expensive but the quality was good and we used it three times out of four. The hotel was adequate - we had a good time in Bologna and it did not detract from our experience; its position in fact enhanced it. But were we to go back, I would want a good deal to return.
reviews.title: Beautiful, but incredibly noisy!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: If you want to be in a bad room where the airco blows like hell and where they cannot do anything about it, you have to go to this hotel.
reviews.title: Lovely gem in Bologna at a great price - definitely recommended!
